variant.p: The IFRIC noted that IFRSs do not contain specific guidance on the measurement of an entity’s equity instruments issued to extinguish all or part of a financial liability. Paragraph 41 of IAS 39 requires an entity to recognise in profit or loss the difference between the carrying amount of the financial liability extinguished and the consideration paid. That paragraph describes ‘consideration paid’ as including non‑cash assets transferred, or liabilities assumed, and does not specifically mention equity instruments issued. Consequently, some are of the view that equity instruments are not ‘consideration paid’.
